## strings and manipulation 

```{r}
string_vec = c("my", "name", "is", "wynter")

str_detect(string_vec, "wynter") ## when you want to find if something exists, used commonly with filter

str_replace(string_vec, "wynter", "Wynter")
```

```{r}
string_vec = c(
  "i think we all rule for participating",
  "i think i have been caught",
  "i think this will be quite fun actually",
  "it will be fun, i think"
  )

str_detect(string_vec, "^i think") ## ^ = starts with/beginning of a line 

str_detect(string_vec, "i think$") ## $ = the ending of a line 
```

```{r}
string_vec = c(
  "Time for a Pumpkin Spice Latte!",
  "went to the #pumpkinpatch last weekend",
  "Pumpkin Pie is obviously the best pie",
  "SMASHING PUMPKINS -- LIVE IN CONCERT!!"
  )

str_detect(string_vec,"[Pp]umpkin") ## [] = anything in the bracket will match, in this case the P and p
```

```{r}
string_vec = c(
  '7th inning stretch',
  '1st half soon to begin. Texas won the toss.',
  'she is 5 feet 4 inches tall',
  '3AM - cant sleep :('
  )

str_detect(string_vec, "^[0-9][a-zA-Z]") ## any line starting with the numbers 0-9, lines with upper and lower case letters a-z 
```

```{r}
string_vec = c(
  'Its 7:11 in the evening',
  'want to go to 7-11?',
  'my flight is AA711',
  'NetBios: scanning ip 203.167.114.66'
  )

str_detect(string_vec, "7.11") # 7, any character, 11 
```

```{r}
string_vec = c(
  'The CI is [2, 5]',
  ':-]',
  ':-[',
  'I found the answer on pages [6-7]'
  )

str_detect(string_vec, "\\[") ## // = any instance where the square bracket exists
```

## factors 
```{r}
vec_sex = factor(c("male", "male", "female", "female"))
vec_sex 
as.numeric(vec_sex)

vec_sex = fct_relevel(vec_sex, "male")
vec_sex
as.numeric(vec_sex)
```

## nsduh dataset

```{r}
nsduh_url = "http://samhda.s3-us-gov-west-1.amazonaws.com/s3fs-public/field-uploads/2k15StateFiles/NSDUHsaeShortTermCHG2015.htm"

table_marj = 
  read_html(nsduh_url) |> 
  html_table() |> 
  first() |>
  slice(-1) #gets rid of the text from the first row that we dont need 
```

```{r}
data_marj = 
  table_marj |>
  select(-contains("P Value")) |>
  pivot_longer(
    -State,
    names_to = "age_year", 
    values_to = "percent") |>
  separate(age_year, into = c("age", "year"), sep = "\\(") |>
  mutate(
    year = str_replace(year, "\\)", ""), 
    percent = str_replace(percent, "[a-b]$", ""),
    percent = as.numeric(percent)) |>
  filter(!(State %in% c("Total U.S.", "Northeast", "Midwest", "South", "West"))) # ! = any time that its not the case 
```

```{r}
data_marj |>
  filter(age == "12-17") |> 
  mutate(State = fct_reorder(State, percent)) |> ## puts the graph in order and makes it look linear 
  ggplot(aes(x = State, y = percent, color = year)) + 
    geom_point() + 
    theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 90, hjust = 1))
```
